They also report feelings of emptiness and disconnection during episodes, alongside moderate anxiety. Communication patterns suggest the patient may be underreporting the loudness and emotional impact of their hallucinations, indicating the possibility of more frequent, louder, and more distressing symptoms than explicitly described. No current evidence of visual hallucinations, paranoia, or command intrusions is noted.
